message: Operation 'post-/marketing/v3/campaigns/batch/read' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. data.current_description:
This endpoint reads a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data and returns the campaigns along with their associated assets. 
 The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.
If duplicate campaign IDs are provided in the request, duplicates will be ignored. The response will include only unique IDs and will be returned without duplicates.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve a batch of campaigns with their associated assets. Accepts up to 50 campaign IDs per request. Returns campaign objects with related assets (Forms, Static lists, External website pages). Note: Response order is not guaranteed to match request order, and duplicate IDs are automatically deduplicated. Useful for bulk retrieval of campaign data.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on input format (campaign IDs) and explicit mention of what is returned. Added specificity about input expectations, clarified the return includes associated assets, and provided context about deduplication behavior. Enhanced AI agent interpretability by explaining when to use batch operations versus single-campaign endpoints.

data.current_description:
This endpoint lists all assets of the campaign by asset type. The assetType parameter is required, and each request can only fetch assets of a single type.
Asset metrics can also be fetched along with the assets; they are available only if start and end dates are provided.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all assets of a specified type for a given campaign. The assetType parameter is required and filters results to a single asset type per request. Optional start and end date parameters enable retrieval of associated asset performance metrics. Returns a paginated list of campaign assets with optional metrics data.

data.current_description:
This endpoint deletes a batch of campaigns. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The response will always be 204 No Content, regardless of whether the campaigns exist or not, whether they were successfully deleted or not, or if only some of the campaigns in the batch were deleted.
data.description_suggestion: Archives a batch of campaigns in a single request. Supports up to 50 campaigns per batch. Returns 204 No Content regardless of campaign existence or deletion success status. Note: This operation does not provide feedback on individual campaign success or failure; use batch read operations to verify archive status.
data.reasoning: Summary uses 'Delete' but endpoint path says 'archive', indicating inconsistent terminology. The description mentions deletion but the path suggests archiving - clarified to use 'archive' for consistency. Added context about lack of individual success feedback to help AI agents understand the operation's limitations and when to use alternative verification methods.

data.current_description:
Delete a specified campaign from the system.
This call will return a 204 No Content response regardless of whether the campaignGuid provided corresponds to an existing campaign or not.

data.reasoning: Summary lacks specificity about the parameter (campaignGuid). Description mentions the 204 response behavior but doesn't clearly communicate the lack of success/failure feedback, which is important for AI agents to understand operation limitations. Enhanced summary adds 'by ID' context, and description clarifies the idempotent behavior and suggests verification methods.

message: Operation 'patch-/marketing/v3/campaigns/{campaignGuid}' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate. Description has good detail about partial updates and error handling, but lacks clarity about what constitutes the request body (which properties can be updated) and doesn't explicitly state the response format. Reference to 'Batch Update' in the empty string context is confusing for a non-batch operation. Enhanced description clarifies the response format and removes confusing batch terminology.

data.current_description:
Perform a partial update of a campaign identified by the specified campaignGuid. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will cause 400 error.
If an empty string is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.
data.description_suggestion: Performs a partial update of a campaign identified by the specified campaignGuid. Only provided properties are modified; omitted properties remain unchanged. Passing an empty string resets a property value. Read-only and non-existent properties trigger a 400 error. Returns the updated campaign object with all current properties.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description has good detail about partial updates and error handling, but lacks clarity about what constitutes the request body (which properties can be updated) and doesn't explicitly state the response format. Reference to 'Batch Update' in the empty string context is confusing for a non-batch operation. Enhanced description clarifies the response format and removes confusing batch terminology.
